events.description: The ECB left its rates unchanged as largely expected during the session.
The BoE held rates but multiple MPC members opted for cuts.
Softening US labor market data impacting European markets.

facts.fact_text: The Eurozone's STOXX 50 fell 0.8% to 5,976 and the European STOXX 600 dropped 1.1% to 612.

evidences.evidence_text: The Eurozone's STOXX 50 fell 0.8% to 5,976 and the European STOXX 600 dropped 1.1% to 612.

facts.fact_text: Shell fell 3.5% after missing profit estimates.

evidences.evidence_text: Shell fell 3.5% after missing profit estimates amid lower crude prices.

facts.fact_text: BBVA tumbled 8.8% as its results failed to meet investor expectations.

evidences.evidence_text: BBVA tumbled 8.8% as its results failed to meet investor expectations.

facts.fact_text: Rheinmetall dropped 6.5% after cutting its guidance.

evidences.evidence_text: Rheinmetall dropped 6.5% after cutting its guidance.

claims.claim_text: President Lagarde downplayed the recent data of softer inflation and concerns of a stronger euro.
claims.author: President Lagarde

evidences.evidence_text: President Lagarde downplayed the recent data of softer inflation and concerns of a stronger euro

claims.claim_text: Lagarde's comments limited bets of incoming interest rate cuts this year.

evidences.evidence_text: limiting bets of incoming cuts this year

claims.claim_text: European stocks closed firmly lower due to negative earnings and hawkish ECB hints.

evidences.evidence_text: European stocks closed firmly lower on Thursday amid a batch of negative earnings, hawkish hints from the ECB
